subject: Ethics
title: The Executive Pay Problem
description: A fast breakdown of The Executive Pay Problem for builders.

hook.text: A CEO earns $25 million a year. The median worker at the same company earns $35,000. That's a 714:1 ratio.

buildup.text: In 1965, CEO-to-worker pay ratio was 21:1. By 2023, it exceeded 340:1 on average at top US firms.

discovery.text: Executive pay is set by boards filled with other executives. It's a club that keeps raising its own prices.

twist.text: Stock options aimed to align CEO interests with shareholders. Instead, CEOs pump short-term prices and cash out.

climax.text: Meanwhile, real wages for workers have barely kept pace with inflation for forty years.

punchline.text: Performance pay for executives. Flat pay for everyone else.

quiz.question: How did the CEO-to-worker pay ratio change from 1965 to 2023?
options: It stayed roughly the same at about 50:1
